subject: Re: [junit] Question about changing the name of tests
msgSnippet: Change the method names to something like testWhatever() where Whatever is a different name for each test. testMyStringStuff() testMyBooleanStuff() etc..
messageBody:
Change the method names to something like testWhatever() where
'Whatever' is a different name for each test.

testMyStringStuff()
testMyBooleanStuff()
etc..

-Shay

Mike Foley wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> I want to change the name of my individual tests in the test report
> and/or in the test results xml file.
>
> I am using the JUnit Recipes Parameterized Test Case Design Pattern,
> and all my tests are then named "doTest". I'd like individual test
> case names, and I am not sure how to do this. I see the method setName
> ()....but if I change it to something other than "doTest" my tests
> fail.
>
> Is it a side-effect of the JUnit Receipes Parameterized Test Case
> Design Pattern that I can't now change test names? Or possibly I just
> don't understand how to set test names programmatically?
>
> Thanks in advance for any ideas,
>
> Mike
>
>

--

... cut twice, paste once.
